title: The fact that there is room for improvement makes me so excited for next year and the Tokyo Olympics
text:
I could not have asked for a better World Championships. It’s not everyday you get to see your sister win a world medal, let alone win one yourself. What made it even more special was knowing that my very first Worlds were at Stuttgart and, although I’m not certain it’s my last, it’s nice to have possibly finished there too.

It’s been a formative experience for us as a team - I think we’ve bonded so much. We went to get the Olympic qualification and it’s incredible that both the men’s and women’s teams have achieved it. Making a team final, for me, was incredibly special.

Seeing Ellie go and perform so well took the pressure off for me ahead of my final on bars. I know hard she’s been working, so to see it all come together was indescribable. Of course I wanted to watch her medal presentation, but this meant I only had 40 minutes to warm up ahead of competing myself. It was a bit of a rush, but I knew I was ready. I’ve been training so hard for that moment.

It was the first time I put that routine at any kind of competition. Until that point we had played it safe, sticking to what I knew to get good results, but for the final I knew I could pull it off. Although my routine wasn’t done as cleanly as I know I’m capable of, I’m grateful I managed to deliver it under that kind of pressure and environment. In the end I was just so happy I’d done it.
description: I could not have asked for a better World Championships.
